conclusion:
Date of Collection/Procedure/Outside Report: 2/15/1986
Date of Receipt: 2/15/1986
Date of Report: 2/19/1986

Clinical Diagnosis & History:
Site 1: Gross/Micro Melanoma Lesion - Changed

Specimens Submitted:
1:  Location, Right Upper Back Scapular Region, Biopsy- Shave

DIAGNOSIS:     
1.  Skin, right upper back, scapular region; shave biopsy:  
    - Features consistent with an early evolving radial growth phase melanoma. (see Note.)

Note: The lesion is small and has the silhouette of a dysplastic nevus.
However, several atypical melanocytes are seen at all layers of the
epidermis. A few similar cells are also seen in the papillary dermis. While
we considered a traumatized dysplastic nevus, the findings are most in
keeping with an early melanoma (0.25 mm thick, Clark level II,
non-ulcerated, with no mitosis; confined to its radial growth phase). The
inked section margins are not involved, but the lesion extends to within < 1
mm of a tissue edge. Levels and an immunostain for melan-A were examined.

I ATTEST THAT THE ABOVE DIAGNOSIS IS BASED UPON MY PERSONAL EXAMINATION OF
THE SLIDES (AND/OR OTHER MATERIAL), AND THAT I HAVE REVIEWED AND APPROVED
THIS REPORT.

John Doe, M.D.
*** Report Electronically Signed Out ***
